intro: Prepodesma, commonly known as the "Australian star goosefoot," is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, often succulent leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plants typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Many species have a creeping or prostrate growth habit, which helps them survive in harsh climates. The fruits are usually small, dry capsules that release seeds when mature.
